metadata.Title: CVE-2018-9138 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.29 and 2.30. Stack Exhaustion occurs in the C++ demangling functions provided by libiberty, and there are recursive stack frames: demangle_nested_args, demangle_args, do_arg, and do_type.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-9138` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.3
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.3
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.3
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.3
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.3

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> same libiberty commit as CVE-2018-12641

criterions.comment: binutils package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.3').
